title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 111.7 - Establishing source of seed
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 111.7 - Establishing source of seed

State Regulations
(a) For certified seed from forest trees the exact geographical source of the
parent trees and the stand history must be known. (b) Where seeds or other propagating
materials are produced from planted or otherwise artificially established
trees, the origin of the parent material must be known. If the origin is not
definitely known the trees must be of high phenotype quality and of sufficient
age to produce the products desired from management. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
111.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
